website_summaries.verdict: Gives you strong performance at all temperatures, while increasing the efficiency of your manual transmission system.
pros: Meets all requirements set forth by Ford for its warranty for manual transmissions, but can be used in any vehicle
Delivers good performance for older transmissions and rear wheel drive vehicles
Synthetic fluid  that works well in many different environments
cons: Some drivers say they don't notice a difference in this fluid, which is pricier than others

customer_reviews.title: The Motorcraft fluid is night and day a better combination with this transmission
customer_reviews.text: This synthetic transmission fluid made a ton of difference in the smoothness of shifts in my 1999 Miata NB six speed transmission vs. the Redline synthetic that was in there before. The old fluid didn't work well with the synchros and resulted in periodic rough shifts. The Motorcraft fluid is night and day a better combination with this transmission. I was skeptical of what I heard about using this fluid in my transmission, but now I'm a firm believer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Hole E Sheeeit... It’s made with unicorn tears.
customer_reviews.text: Just put this in my 2000 Miata manual transmission with 130k miles. I was getting the hard shift into 1ft and 2nd. I read a lot of online forums and articles on what is the best and I have to agree with my findings. This has to be unicorn tears as my Miata has never ever shifted so flawlessly and on the freeway I’ve noticed it’s removed a lot of the Transmission noise. Took exactly 2 quarts totally worth the $60
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Like magic sauce
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is, BUY THIS NOW. I have now used this transmission fluid in two different Miatas, a 1993 NA and 2006 NC. 2 quarts is all you need and it is worth every cent. I noticed dramatic improvements with cold shifts and overall smoothness of syncros. New or old, your transmission will feel 10X better than before. Cannot recommend this enough. Read the reviews on Miata sites and forums, you'll see the same level of enthusiasm for this XT-M5-QS.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in my manual 2017 Tacoma TRD Off Road
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the original Toyota fluid, amsoil, redline mt90, and this, which was recommended on a Tacoma enthusiast forum. Redline is quite good, an improvement over the OEM fluid, but is a little thick and sluggish under colder conditions. Amsoil is really bad; expect synchro grinding and notchiness. This Ford fluid is top notch in terms of smoothness and getting rid of notchiness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Choose wisely, this is what you want to buy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome additive. My 2007 Ford Focus uses 2.2 quarts. At 125,000 miles, my transmission was having issues with shifting, especially when cold. I read that changing the transmission oil would potentially help. I tried mixing Redline and this and it worked great for about 1000 miles and then went back to hard shifting. I purchased 3 quarts of XT-M5-QS and changed my oil again. It shifts as smooth as butter now. I would highly suggest this fluid and also recommend NOT mixing and matching different brands. This is an excellent oil and has really revived my 07 Focus.
customer_reviews.author: Trusted Buyer

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Used to use redline mt90 for my 03 miata's six speed manual. My shifter felt notchy and stiff until the car warmed up. Then I started developing a crunch going into third gear. I heard that some miata guys have had success with the Ford stuff so I gave it a try. The shifter is consistently smooth regardless of the transmission fluid temperature and I haven't heard the crunch since. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Alvord

customer_reviews.title: OEM Synthetic Ford Manual Tranny Fluid
customer_reviews.text: This product is what Ford recommends to many of their manual transmissions. I use it in my BOSS302 as directed in the maintenance schedule for track use. My first purchase came in as pictured. However, my second purchase came in with a new updated (plain) label that threw me for a look. I researched it and it seems Ford has changed their formulation in the past 6-12 months and at the same time the label changed. You can see this by reading the back of the bottle as they list the year of the revision of the fluid there. Overall, a great fluid even with the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Best MTL for Miatas PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: Do you Have a Miata? Are you tired of that 2nd or 3rd gear notch yet? I bought an NA with 25k, changed the gear oil at 60k with redline, felt the same as factory, snappy but it would sometimes catch a bit in 2nd,(new bushings at 60k too) at 118k I put this stuff in, after draining the liquid glitter from the last 58k of abuse. Within 25 miles I noticed a difference l, it was already smoother and towed between gears better than it did 25k. It was night and day difference and it stayed that way.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: For Fords by Ford.  Motorcraft just works.
customer_reviews.text: The maximum service interval is 100k. So decided it was time. This Ford "honey" for manual transmission in my 2007 Focus comes highly recommended. Day 1 - 12/21/2019 shifting definitely improved. Wouldn't say night and day difference but I'm sure the mtx is happier regardless. Will update in a few thousand miles with any additional updates or changes in function.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results for my 2008 Miata NC1 6 speed transmission
customer_reviews.text: I had my transmission fluid changed today. I noticed better synchro results starting with the first mile. I can easily shift between 1st, 2nd, and 3rd where it was notchy before. The transmission is noticeable more quiet with no rumble or whine. It should be interesting putting a few more miles on. I am very pleased with the results so far.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas L. Dean

customer_reviews.title: "Butta smooth"
customer_reviews.text: Was time for trans. oil change on my '07 Miata and this is highly regarded as the "go to" for that application. I was hoping to reduce the notchy 1-2 shift you get with the six speed on your first couple shifts, until things get good and lubedricated, but honestly that has not happened. On the plus side, the shifts are "butta smooth" and you can just rip through the gears with no resistance at all...fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Difference
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my 2007 Mazda Miata. I bought it used at 50k miles; now it has 85k. I'm not sure how well the previous owner treated it. I put this in and shifting is so much easier that my wife (in the passenger seat) noticed the difference. My only complaint is that the car needs 2.2 qts so I had to buy three.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haugh

customer_reviews.title: Silky smooth shifts on 2011 MX5 Miata
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to test out why people in the miata forums worship this trans fluid. This is no joke, my shifts turned from crunchy to buttery smooth especially between 1st to 2 and 3. I drained my old oil from the shifter turret and topped off with the same fluid. 230cc according to the manufacturer. This stuff works like a dream, I know people complain about the price to be on the high side, In my opinion you get what you pay for. Great product Ford!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.P

customer_reviews.title: A bit of an improvement
customer_reviews.text: It was time for a change of transmission oil in my Miata, and I tried this on the basis of recommendations from the Miata.net site. I'd been using Redline MTL without complaint previously, and find that shifts are a bit easier with this Ford product though I wouldn't call the difference dramatic. I'm glad I made the change, but wouldn't speed up a change of lubricant to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Happy it’s on Prime!
customer_reviews.text: Ideal oil for Mazda Miata, and easy to get on Amazon instead of trying to call around to dealerships to see if they have it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Made my Tranny Smooth as Silk!
customer_reviews.text: My Gen1 Speed3 had a Redline Manual Transmission Fluid. I jumped into the wagon with the Ford Tranny fluid. After a brief break in, just to get the fresh new oil get into the gears, I am now able to shift from 2nd to 3rd so smoothly! Before i was having some struggle and sometimes grind it during this transition. I am so glad i switched to this fluid!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day in my Mazdaspeed
customer_reviews.text: My 2008 Mazdaspeed 3 had about 85000 miles on it so I decided to have the manual transmission gear oil changed (even though there is no recommendation in the owners manual). The local shop used Mobil Delvac synthetic. Within 100 miles the differential was making a whirring sound when turning the car left or right. Internet research suggested XT-M5-QS is the only oil to use. This replaced the Delvac and the noise went away. This is the only oil to use for the Mazda 6-gear transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Number 6

customer_reviews.title: Best transmission oil for the 6 speed MX5 transmission
customer_reviews.text: This product really works! Having tried several locally available transmission oils and additives none of which improved the difficulty experienced in shifting gears particularly following start up, I decided to try some XT-M5-QS. I am very happy to report this stuff has improved movement through the 6 speed manual gearbox. In particular the lower gears which were almost truck like with the local 75W-90 fully synthetic oils.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Harris

customer_reviews.title: Got my transmission shifting smoothly again!
customer_reviews.text: I had the transmission fluid in my RX-8 changed at a local garage. They replaced the fluid with regular GL-5 lube which caused hard shifts and grinding of gears (especially when shifting into 2nd gear). I dumped that out and replaced it with this and my transmission is back to being a smooth shifter! If you're thinking of getting this for your RX-8's transmission, just stop thinking and get it!
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Berrios

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I read about this in some miata forums. Figured I'd give it a shot. This stuff is the best. I won't run anything else in my 6 speed manual transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Joshie T.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my 13 MX-5 Miata. It took me a little while to figure out what was the correct fluid. After much research this turned out to be the correct one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, its great stuff, my Mazda RX8 gen1 really loves this stuff in the manual transmission. If you have a Asin 6 speed in your car, like the Honda S200 or Mazda RX8 this is the trans lube that you have been looking for. That crunchy 1st to 2nd shift will be completely gone with in 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: 2011 NC2 Mazda MX-5
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced. I was under the impression it would make shifting smoother/less notchy in cold weather. Did not make a difference in shifting. Stick with Redline, Miata folks. It’s a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hoss

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: The best fluid for my RX-8. Seriously, smoothest, no balking when downshifting on the track, works well in all temperatures. It's pricey but definitely worth it. I've also read NC Miata owners love it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kositarut

customer_reviews.title: On the track the car would heat up and the shifting would get noticeably worse as the session progressed
customer_reviews.text: This fluid made a very noticeable difference in my Miata 6 speed, turbo. On the track the car would heat up and the shifting would get noticeably worse as the session progressed. This problem is virtually solved with the use of this fluid. I highly recommend giving it a try
customer_reviews.author: that guy

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I flushed my 2008 Focus manual transmission after 115k miles. Owners manual says every 105k. Gears now shift like butter. I mean BUTTER. I really didn't think new fluid could be so drastic. I will now be flushing my gearbox every 50k miles at least.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Smith

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I used in my MX5 Miata manual transmission and it got rid of the "2nd gear crunch" that many Miatas are known for. Previously was using Mobile1 75-90, but the Ford fluid makes for better gear shifting.
customer_reviews.author: dudeman618

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I use motorcraft with any ford. When it comes to oil I use Lucas additive but this has never let me down. 130,000 miles this stuff has lasted. I couldn’t see why I couldn’t go more, but I figure it’s about time.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: 1991 Miata Unicorn Fluid
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, this stuff is amazing for a Miata. I put this in my 91 Miata and now it shifts just as good if not better than any brand new modern car. The difference it makes is stupid. If you have a NA Miata and you are not using this I'm sorry for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ball

customer_reviews.title: Worked great as a replacement for 2006 Mazda MX-5 Miata MT ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great as a replacement for 2006 Mazda MX-5 Miata MT oil. Downshifts with cold transmission are considerably easier than with whatever was previously loaded.
customer_reviews.author: The Kolbe Family

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, this stuff is as good as they say. It does take awhile before the effectiveness is fully developed. Used it on a Mazdaspeed 3, and plan to get dune for my Toyota GT86 when it needs to be changed
customer_reviews.author: Heatherlun Uphold

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for Mazdaspeed 3 owners
customer_reviews.text: I was running Royal Purple In my 2013 Mazdaspeed 3 this past year and was not happy. It would take a while for the oil to warm up before the gears would go in smooth, very noisy on tight turns, wasn't that big of a deal, just annoying. I just flushed it and went back to the XT-M5-QS. No more noise from the differential, smooth gear engagement, feels like a new car.
customer_reviews.author: louis

customer_reviews.title: As good as I heard it was
customer_reviews.text: After reading good reviews of this stuff I figured I would give it a shot. I replaced Redline MT-90 manual transmission fluid with this and it really does shift smoother, especially in colder weather where the transmission was a little notchy with the Redline until fully warmed up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Magic in my Miata
customer_reviews.text: Put this stuff in your manual transmission. Put this stuff in your manual transmission. Said that twice. GREAT trans lube, I'd have never believed how much better the car would shift with this stuff if others hadn't sworn by it first. Expensive, and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Noblehops

customer_reviews.title: MS3 Transmission Shifts Like a Knife Through Butter
customer_reviews.text: Used this in a Mazdaspeed 3; shifting has never been so smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip S

customer_reviews.title: Used in a 2003 Mazda miata 5 speed manual. ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in a 2003 Mazda miata 5 speed manual. I had redline mt90 in the tranny before, worked well when it was warmed up. In the cold I had a tough time putting it into first and crunched going into second. I am no long having any of those issues with this stuff!! Gear changes are even smoother too!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stutz

customer_reviews.title: The car runs better
customer_reviews.text: The synthetic fluid improved the manual transmission and works better
customer_reviews.author: HUWER

customer_reviews.title: Used it in my 1990 Miata, much improved shift ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my 1990 Miata, much improved shift quality as well as cold weather performance compared to whatever unknown fluid was in there.
customer_reviews.author: Gangyi Li

customer_reviews.title: The literal gold standard
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best transmission oil money can buy currently. Has greatly improved shiftier feel and reliability in all of my vehicles. Well worth the cost if you plan on keep your car since its rated for life once its in.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Watson

customer_reviews.title: Slick
customer_reviews.text: Changed the transmission oil in my 2001 Miata 6-speed to this based on forum recommendations. Shifts are already a bit smoother after about 1,000 miles of driving. Haven't noticed a difference in gas mileage.
customer_reviews.author: DaveAs

customer_reviews.title: What people should use for smooth shifting!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my NA 1997 MX-5 Miata. Shifts like butter!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: It seems good.
customer_reviews.text: Two bottles is more than enough for a 1.8 NA Miata. I'm not sure that I notice any real difference, but the old stuff looked bad it's probably good to do.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewName

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my 2000 ford focus. The car shifts better than before. It's expensive at $30 a quart when I bought it, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES M LINDSAY II

customer_reviews.title: preferred by numerous owners
customer_reviews.text: better than what it replaced as a very good price
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for your NC Miata
customer_reviews.text: Night and day difference in shift quality in a 2006 MX-5.
customer_reviews.author: cbax19

customer_reviews.title: Not an urban legend
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the OEM fluid in my 2014 Miata 6-speed manual and noticed almost immediate improvement. Gear engagement is smoother - also seems to overcome occasional snags caused by the sometimes non-precise/variable engagement of the Miata clutch assembly (not an overwhelming problem - probably mostly driver induced error).
customer_reviews.author: M. Edlund

customer_reviews.title: Was better than what was in there
customer_reviews.text: Used in my 2012 RX8 with 20000 Km on the clock. Smoothed the transmission a bit but still notchy on some changes. Was better than what was in there, but not sure what that was. Will try Redline next time.
customer_reviews.author: Murray Price

customer_reviews.title: It is Unicorn Tears
customer_reviews.text: The prophecy is true, this is the unicorn tears. Jokes aside, this cleared up my reverse gear issue on my 2001 Miata NB. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: marlee

customer_reviews.title: Miata owners swear by it with good reason
customer_reviews.text: This is a must mod mentioned on all MX-5 Miata websites and it does what they all say: much smoother shifts. Pricey for the necessary three quarts but well worth it. I got it for my 2012 NC Mx-5 and am buying more for my wife's 2004 Mazdaspeed MX-5.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. L

customer_reviews.title: 99' 6-Speed Miata
customer_reviews.text: Works great, honestly shocked at what a noticeable difference it made. Used in a 1999 Mazda Miata 6-speed.
customer_reviews.author: pedro caceres

customer_reviews.title: If you have an MTX75 you have to run this fluid. Decent price for it here.
customer_reviews.text: If you have an MTX75 you have to run this fluid. Pricey but worth it. I have almost 300k miles on my trans.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently running this on a Mazdaspeed 3 and wow what an improvement. The shifts are smooth and quiet for the most part. Sure it's extremely pricey, but it was highly recommended from some highly modified Mazdaspeed 3 driver. Be sure to do you research before purchasing to be sure that it's right for your application.
customer_reviews.author: Darryll King

customer_reviews.title: Unicorn Blood
customer_reviews.text: Besides being horridly expensive this stuff is like pure unicorn blood for your transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Smoother shifting Miata in under an hour.  Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Tranny gold. Buy this for your Miata now. Takes two
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a brand new transmission
customer_reviews.text: It is absolutely incredible what a difference in shifting this fluid has made over the OE fluid in my Mazdaspeed3. Feels like a brand new transmission. It is not cheap, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I heard good things about this stuff, and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is amazing and seems to get better as you put more ...
customer_reviews.text: This may as well be transmission rebuild in a bottle. This stuff is amazing and seems to get better as you put more mileage on it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tabarracci

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my '99 Miata with a 5-speed, and could feel the difference. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Must for Miata
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but the improvement in shifts is amazing! Used in '90 Miata.
customer_reviews.author: David Turner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 2007 Suzuki SX4 manual transmission. I replaced Redline with XT-M5 and it shifts smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyah

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This greatly helped reduce the "notchy" feeling in my 2009 Mazda Miata (especially when cold outside). Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Best Gearbox Oil for a MTX 75 Gearbox.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and have put in my gearbox. This product is excellent and after reading great reviews about this decided to purchase. The only problem I have with this product is hat it is very expensive. Having said this I believe it is better paying that little bit more to get the best.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: as it took more force than I would like. It's only been three weeks since the change
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ford Ranger with 140K miles. It has the 2.3 four cylinder with a manual 5-speed. I put this fluid in the transmission to improve the ease of shifting into first or reverse when stopped, as it took more force than I would like. It's only been three weeks since the change, but the improvement is considerable. (The clutch master cylinder and slave cylinder are working properly.)
customer_reviews.author: Old_malc88

customer_reviews.title: Also seems to drop in to reverse much better.
customer_reviews.text: Just put this in my Miata Mazdaspeed 6 speed MT. Has made a huge improvment in the feel of the shifter. No more crunching when shifting from 1st to 2nd when cold. Also seems to drop in to reverse much better.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this for an NA Miata. Shifting was improved, but not drastically so.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The correct oil for the transmission on my 2006 Mazda Miata
customer_reviews.author: Robert Van Houtte

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended by an auto forum and they stated that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by an auto forum and they stated that it would resolve synchro trouble which I found hard to believe. This is the smoothest shifting my car has ever been... This stuff works!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Swannie

customer_reviews.title: For Miata NC mx5
customer_reviews.text: Made my mx5 Miata NC 6 speed shifter a bit smoother, most noticeable after day 4 of driving, I did the turret oil too, worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unicorn Tears
customer_reviews.text: Using this on 04 Mazdaspeed miata. Youll need 2 quarts. Seems to have improved shift quality.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: This is what a tranny is SUPPOSED to feel like.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 2Gen RX8 last fall that had a slight crunch going into 5th and 6th. Changed out the trans fluid for the proper GL-4 Amsoil and the crunch was still there for the most part. Swapped the Ford XT-M5-QS in this weekend, and after 5 miles of circulating the fluid in the tranny, 5th and 6th no longer grind. As a bonus, I can now shift into 1st gear while still decelerating. Before, I would have to come to a complete stop before the tranny allowing me to get back into 1st. This is what a tranny is SUPPOSED to feel like.
customer_reviews.author: Artillery Rambler

customer_reviews.title: OMG THIS STUFF IS THE BUSINESS. I used it ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG THIS STUFF IS THE BUSINESS. I used it on my Miata's transmission and it really makes it shift smoother!
customer_reviews.author: Horizon

customer_reviews.title: Cured majority of the 3rd gear grinding I had on ...
customer_reviews.text: Cured majority of the 3rd gear grinding I had on my 04 Miata! Very impressed. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Liao

customer_reviews.title: Great price, worked great
customer_reviews.text: Did a fluid swap on my 02 ford focus 5spd manual and this is what Ford recommended. Waaaaay cheaper here than any dealership or parts store. Worked great!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Oehler

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is highly recommended from people in the know & and since I ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is highly recommended from people in the know & and since I put this liquid gold in my ride, it's been on the money!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best oil for my Miata manual transmission. Fast ship. Best price I could find.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it as the MTX-75 is picky about it's fluid.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mazdaspeed 3
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my 2007 Mazdaspeed 3's gearbox. Silky smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miata's BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: This is better than sliced bread when used in a Mazda Miata 5 or 6 speed. It shifts like the best transmission ever. Solved all the rough shifting Miata's are known for.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene N Borscheid

customer_reviews.title: Great for worn Miata synchros
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. I used it in my 95 Miata, my synchro from 4th to 3rd was worn and would always make a grinding noise. Shortly after using this stuff no more grinding at all at any rpm. Would highly recommend for older rear wheel drive vehicles especially Miatas. About 6 months later and still no more grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a used 2006 miata with 40k mi, little tight getting into 3rd gear. Previous fluid was pretty black when I drained it. Put this stuff in and shifting was improved. Driven about 1k mi since I added this fluid and shifting still got better with use. Every gear slips right in .. good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff on earth for your Miata or S2000 manual transmission
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the only transmission fluid I will put in my Mazdaspeed 6.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing result on 2006 Miata
customer_reviews.text: Used it on 2006 NC Miata. The result is amazing. Changed transmission oil + added oil inside shifter. WHY DIDN'T I DO THIS BEFORE?
customer_reviews.author: Irakli M.

customer_reviews.title: The cold shifting issues went away just like everyone else's experiences
customer_reviews.text: Just put this fluid in my 2004 Lamborghini Murcielago, and wow! The cold shifting issues went away just like everyone else's reviews. I tried Red Line and Motul before this Ford fluid, and there's no comparison -- this stuff is the best. Plus it's perfectly spec'd for the Lambo. I am going to try it in my Lotus Esprit next.
customer_reviews.author: PH from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, brought new life to my 2013 'Speed3!

customer_reviews.title: smoother shifting
customer_reviews.text: Added to my 02 Miata 6 speed and improved cold shifting as well as shifting overall.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome! Dramatic difference in shift quality
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! Dramatic difference in shift quality! Before, 1st gear was extremely notchy when cold. Now its as smooth as silk. I strongly recommend this stuff to all Miata owners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miata 6-spd. Accept no substitutes. Absolutely lived up ...
customer_reviews.text: Miata 6-spd. Accept no substitutes. Absolutely lived up to the hype. She's particular. Get her what she wants. Ask questions later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Put 2qt in my 95 miata
customer_reviews.text: It feels so new already but it's the kind of oil you let "soak in". It only can get better from here.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for my '99 miata, but did not deliver on expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I heard this fluid from the miata forum to be the best and makes them shifts buttery smooth. Not in my case. My 1st to 2nd gear shift is not as smooth as I think it should be. (Bought car used). After using this fluid, I only noticed a smooth shift from 3rd to 4th and to 5th. The 1st to 2nd seems the same, maybe a slight difference but not much as other users have noticed unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: I Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gear shifts are so much smoother after switching to the XT-M5-QS fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang T.

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Ford Spec
customer_reviews.text: This product is Ford Spec for manual transmissions like the Getrag 6 speed transmission in my Ford Focus SVT. I will order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: 2turbos

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, shifts like a knife through butter!
customer_reviews.text: This "magical" transmission fluid really is magical. I didn't think it would make that big of a difference but it truly did. Will totally buy this again. If you have a 6 speed miata (or perhaps any miata, whatever this stuff works in) do yourself a favor and buy it. It made the car more enjoyable. No more annoying 1 -> 2 crunch, it just slides into every gear like a knife through butter now.
customer_reviews.author: bcredeur97

customer_reviews.title: this stuff works great!
customer_reviews.text: for anyone wanting smoother shifting on their mazdaspeed 3, this stuff works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smoother shifting for Miata 6 speed.
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my Mazdaspeed Miata, and noticed a big difference in shifting. A bit pricey, but I think it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: VictorJ Knight

customer_reviews.title: I listened to the internet and it delivered.
customer_reviews.text: Bought some for my 2006 MX-5 GT (6 speed) and it makes the shifter feel like it has butter inside. Note that the car has over 100k miles on it and still feels new. Coupled with redline in the rear dif, the car drives like a dream on the street and at autocross.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: No issues!
customer_reviews.text: Changed the trans fluid as part of a complete tune up on my car. Can't say the shifting feels too much smoother, but the fluid that came out was pretty bad and I'm definitely glad I put the correct spec fluid in there instead of some generic gear lube like most people do. Have been driving with it for a while now with no issues. Cheaper than buying this stuff at the dealership too!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: A++ manual trans fluid, plays well with the brass ...
customer_reviews.text: A++ manual trans fluid, plays well with the brass syncros and nylon shifter fork pads. Rebuilt the trans at 150k miles myself so I would know. Also seems to quiet down trans bearing noise.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but works very well. I used it in both my 1994 Miata and my SVT Focus.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Varner

product_meta.title: Genuine Ford Fluid XT-M5-QS Full Synthetic Manual Transmission Fluid - 1 Quart
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1Motorcraft Full Synthetic Manual Transmission Fluid is a premium-quality SAE 75W-90 gear oil recommended by Ford Motor Company meeting warranty requirements. It is particularly recommended for 1995-2011 MTX-75 and IB5 transmissions, and is also recommended for older transmissions including rear wheel drive that recommend GL-3 and GL-4 type gear oils.
feature_bullets: Use according to owner guide recommendations
Manufactured with synthetic base oils and performance additives providing improved gear shifting at all ambient temperatures
Due to its excellent thermal, oxidative and shear stability, this fluid meets Ford’s fill-for-life requirements
Its wear protection extends the life of synchronizers and bearings
Reduced friction and optimal lubrication reduces operating temperatures, increases component life and improves efficiency

specifications.Cover Included: Ford XT-M5-QS Full Synthetic Manual Transmission - 1 Quart
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars208 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
